Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: IanWLondon
Reviews.Content: A tiny hotel, but it has the one thing you want for a short break, the prefect location. Have stayed three times now and the staff are always very welcoming and happy to help. You are obviously paying or the location, but if your only in the city for a short time its worth paying for the convenience. We will go back next year

Reviews.Title: “Great location. very friendly”
Reviews.Author: blackfpp
Reviews.Content: Stayed 11th april for honeymoon. Close to st marks square. clean, very friendly. small room but has everything you need. can't praise staff highly enough, so helpful. only drw back for us was no lobby or bar. everything else was superb.

Reviews.Title: “We walked straight past!”
Reviews.Author: Mahalia
Reviews.Content: My husband had been to Venice before and was confident that he knew where the Hotel Torino was. We walked straight past! The entrance is just a door between two shops, right on the corner of the street and easy to miss. We found the staff extremely welcoming and helpful, arranging water taxis for us and giving us advice on what to do while in Venice. Our room was gorgeous, not huge but quite 'roomy' with a rather modern en suite. Breakfast, served in the breakfast room, was simple but generous. There were several reasonably priced restaurants close by as well. The Piazza San Marco was about 7 minutes walk, if that, so the Hotel was ideally suited for seeing many of Venice's attractions, and there was a convenient landing nearby for water taxis, for trips further afield. We caught the Alilaguna from the airport to the Piazza San Marco and walked to the Hotel with our luggage, without any problems, other than the fact that we walked straight past! :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a romantic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Caz_Mikey_11
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a lovely 3 day break at Hotel Torino, Venice. After booking the hotel and reading the reviews on here I was actually dreading the holiday! When we arrived at the hotel we was greated by the hotel receptionist who was extremley polite and helpfull. He confirmed that we would be staying in the annex (which I then quickly requested to be moved to the main hotel after reading most reviews on here!) The receptionist said that this was ok to do but would be an extra 20euros per night. We agreed to look at the room in the annex and decide from there. When we entered the room we was very surprised. The room was extremley clean and very cosy. Some may say it was small but we didn't find it much of a problem. Therefore we decided to stay in the annex. The location of the hotel is perfect! We were amazed at how centrally located it was to St Marks Square, lovely restaurants and amazing shops!! The nightlife in Venice isn't extactly jumping and the bars do close around midnight. We found a lovely bar called H&K which is just around the corner from St Marks Square. The prices were reasonable and the staff were extremley nice. If you do have the pleasure in visting Venice in the not so distant future then you can't beat the Hotel Torino for location and price. I would definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in this lovely, traditional Venetian hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Trophie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two rooms at Hotel Torino - a smaller room in what they call the Annexe (just a quick walk around the corner from the main hotel entrance). The room was very clean and included a king size canopy bed, tv, fridge, desk and a very good air conditioner - it was extremely hot while we were there but our room was always very cool and comfortable. When we moved rooms to the main hotel half way through our stay, the staff arranged to have all of our luggage moved for us which was appreciated. Our second room in the main hotel was called the blue room - wow! It had been newly renovated, the room was huge and included a cupboard, desk, two sitting chairs and a very comfy arm chair. The bathroom looked brand new and all very clean. Roberto on the front desk was fantastic and very helpful. Wifi was also included. There was a good selection for breakfast and was available until 10.30am. We'd definitely recommend and will be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “I had reservation at Torino Hotel, but I stayed at anex: dirty, awful!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia R
Reviews.Content: I bought a double room with breakfast at the Hotel Torino, but when I arrived at the hotel I was told to stay in the annex another building of inferior quality which is close to the hotel. The hotel employee said the problem always with the customers who bought from DECOLAR and that the hotel could not do anything since the error was not theirs. DECOLAR site there is no clarification or information note about this difference, that there are two buildings for the same hotel with different prices and quality. Site from TORINO hotel has no explanation either. The address from reservation is Torino "official" hotel and not the other buiding "annex". Be aware about this.

Reviews.Title: “nice place with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: not-a-redshirt
Reviews.Content: Hotel shows signs of wear and the rooms could use a freshening up. Staff is quite helpful with suggestions, and made calls for me to help with our car rental arrangements. Good location being close to Piazza San Marco and the Grand Canal, but no views from the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “cheap hotel - central location - price/quality fair”
Reviews.Author: koen75koen
Reviews.Content: We have spent a weekend in June in this hotel. The hotel is centrally located in Venice which was quite practical. Our rooms were in an annex building. This is an old building that doesn't look like a hotel and is very much outdated in terms of comfort. Rooms were clean though. Basic comfort. Staff at the reception was friendly. We paid 120 euro per night per room which is a fair price given the location in this beautiful city and the "quality" of the room.

Reviews.Title: “good base near san marco”
Reviews.Author: mariemanila
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and everything went well despite what I have read from the reviews. We made sure our room was in the main building and it was so. The room was spacious, room decor was typical venetian and the bathroom was modern. We compared the room with another chain hotel nearby with a higher rate and we felt our room was better and we were happy with our choice. Breakfast was simple but adequate. The staffs at the front desk were friendly, checking in and out were easy, we couldn't find any fault with our stay. It was near Plaza San Marco and many shops and restaurants around. It was a good base to explore around even at night.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, Dirty and Scary”
Reviews.Author: RodrigoBranas
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights with my wife in this awful and disgusting place. We arrived late in the night (01:00 am) with almost 60kg of luggage. At the moment of our checkin we were informed that the room is not in the hotel but in some kind of anex. That anex is a kind of old building placed in a scary and dark street without any security. I had to climb up to the 4th floor (no lift) carring all of the luggage over a small, bizzare, dirty and long stair. The room was even worst. Dirty, phone not working, water very cold or hot and a very old tv. For almost 140 euros per night I surely expected something better. It was the worst experience with a hotel in my life. Please run away of this place!

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Venetian hotel”
Reviews.Author: FeeFee86
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 night stay in Venice this morning. I stayed at Hotel Torino, although it was tricky to find (isn't everything in Venice?), this hotel was absolutely charming. Very well located with shopping, designer boutiques (Chanel, Prada, Gucci, Miu Miu etc) pretty canal, restaurants literally on the doorstep. We had a room in the annex, which had a lovely terrace. Bathroom was modern, but the rest of the room was traditionally venetian, with painted furniture and fabric wallcoverings. Not my usual taste, but it certainly suited the surroundings, and was clean. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed in better”
Reviews.Author: oscarwoo1679
Reviews.Content: We had the "honeymoon Suite" with a large canopy bed. The room was a little dark, and a bit dirty. I dropped something on the floor and it rolled under the bed, when i looked under it was disgusting. The shower was VERY hot, to the point of being scoulding. An ok hotel, have stayed in worse but have also stayed in better.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel, well located with helpful staff and a friendly owner”
Reviews.Author: sufjan-andy
Reviews.Content: Whilst i can't speak about the annex part of the hotel, I CAN say the main building was very pleasant, very clean and well located indeed. Our ensuite bathroom was small but spotless, the room delightful and breakfast was enjoyable and filling. We found the staff to be smiling and helpful, especially the porter who showed us to our room and even the owner himself, who was happy to make conversation and help with our requests. It is always more difficult to deal with the staff if you have to complain (as those who stayed in the annex may have experienced it seems), but the only minor negative i can think of was that the aircon unit was slightly noisy during the night, but we really had nothing to complain about. I very much look forward to coming back to Venice someday and if so, I hope we are able to stay here again. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: 186356Deb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel whilst the carnival was on. We stayed in the main hotel and I was pleasantly surprised especially after reading some reviews. It was really well placed, a couple of minutes you in in San Marco square and 5 to 10 minutes you could reach the rialto bridge. The room was very spacious and clean. The staff I found to most helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible.”
Reviews.Author: Christifemus
Reviews.Content: Horrible! The room was outside the main hotel in some stinky, weird building 70m away. When i saw the room (special double!) i was ready to go back straight away.During my whole stay i didn`t use the shower due to its dirtiness. TV was not working at all and although i ordered to fix that they didn`t do a thing with it. I was supposed to have a view on a channel, instead of that i saw a wall within 2m and a ....wall (what a surprise?) in the other window. Room was out of any standards within even 2 stars but the breakfast beat me up. It was a choice of... toast bread and normal bread with...honey or jam...no meat or cheese at all....not to mention tea in dirty kettle and orange juice mixed with water....it was disgusting. I could`nt wait to leave that place

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend getaway to Venice.”
Reviews.Author: elgomez
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a surprise trip for my boyfriend's birthday because of the location and the price. After I booked it I read some reviews on TripAdvisor and I was so worried that I had made a mistake... everyone made it sound so awful! I emailed them to confirm my reservation, and they were very nice and confirmed me for the main building, which surprised me because based on the price I paid (90 euro for two nights the weekend before carnivale) I assumed that we would be in the annex. We arrived in the late afternoon and a very nice guy at the desk checked us in. We enjoyed some friendly teasing banter with him, he was funny. The hotel is in a cozy corner on the street and really pretty on the inside. We had an adorable room (314) with a beautiful view of rooftops, and we could see the Campanile at San Marco from our bathroom window. I guess I can see what people mean when they say the rooms are small, but unless you're planning on running sprints around your bed, I wouldn't worry about it. We were on the third floor and though there was a lift we never took it, the stairs weren't bad. Maybe it was because we're spry college students :). I actually think our age played a big part in our enjoyment of the hotel, because it felt really really nice to us. I can see older people having complaints about the size of the room and the size of the shower and the stairs. One thing that struck us was how quiet it is! I guess with no cars, there's a lot less noise. we had a great night's sleep.Breakfast was yummy, and they'll bring it to you in your room in the morning which we loved. The rooms were clean, the bathroom was gorgeous (towel warmers! mmmm), and the staff was very nice and helpful; they all spoke great english (phew!) and were very willing to help you find things around the city. I can't speak for the annex, but I was under the impression when I read reviews that it's this awful back building and when you check in the staff suddenly becomes evil because you didn't pay as much and then they shove you in a horrible room. Having been to the hotel now, I want to assuage anyone's fears and tell you that this hotel is very nice, clean, respectable, and just plain pretty. I had a perfect weekend, and this hotel was a big part of that. One of my favorite parts of the trip was sitting out our windowsill looking at the rooftops around us, eating bruschetta. I think the staff takes the reviews they find online to heart; I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, well located.”
Reviews.Author: SileneP
Reviews.Content: Although it was difficult to find the Hotel, it was Ok. Despite you have to turn on the button of the lift to move it, without stopping it, it's better than clibing stairs! Breakfast not very good as the others we found in Italy. But the location was very good, near S Marcos Square, near good restaurants. Staff was nice and helpfull when asked. We stayed at the main building. We heard that the annex building was not very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location... very old room”
Reviews.Author: mickanna
Reviews.Content: We were excited to see the foyer of this hotel as it was clean, somewhat modern and quite promising. However, when we checked in the bellboy walked us outside and around the corner to a dark alley and told us that our room was in a building in the alleyway. We had 2 suitcases which we needed to carry up the 78 stairs to our room. The room was very old and the shower was broken. We didn't sleep very well and it was a real pain to walk up and down the stairs a few times a day. I was definitely not recommend this hotel to an elderly couple. The location is great, it's only meters from st mark's square and is surrounded by designer stores.

Reviews.Title: “a very nice cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: natalie027
Reviews.Content: we stay 3 days at hotel torino in the maine building, we had a very good timethe hotel is located in the heart of venice, staff very efficient and friendly , good deal to give informations for typical restaurants and events, room at the third floor with a good view and clean , the atmosphere very familial and our wish is to come back for the summer

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE, TERRIBLE ANNEX --GET INFORMED BEFORE BOOKING”
Reviews.Author: maria_1008
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Expedia.com. The photos were gorgeous, well located and it offered a free breakfast. THAT IS NOT WHAT WE GOT! Instead, we were rudely informed the minute we checked in that breakfast was NOT included because we did not book directly through the hotel. Then then brought us to their annex, which is an ugly, horrible house-like location that floods and has no elevator. We had to climb 6 flights of stairs while carrying our luggage. The front desk staff was incredibly rude, although I witnessed them being very pleasant to a couple of Italian origin. If you are an American, do NOT stay here, we are NOT welcomed here. They would not even provide me with directions. The only good thing about this horrible place is the location, but there are much nicer hotels in the same area that will most likely provide you with excellent service for your dollar. I wish I had read the reviews before spending my money for this horrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a great position”
Reviews.Author: sgandagh
Reviews.Content: We cannot understand the reviews that have been published about this hotel recently, and do not recognise what is described at all. We stayed in the annexe in a room on the third floor. Admittedly, there was no lift (the hotel website tells you this) but the porter carried our bags to our room and the helpful receptionist told us to phone through to arrange for our bags to be brought down at the end of our stay. The room was a reasonable size and very comfortable, and the twin beds made up to a double proved no problem (this is quite common in European hotels and gives you a really big bed!). The bathroom was fine, with towels which were not, perhaps, as fluffy as in a 5-star hotel but were spotlessly clean and a good size. Plenty of hot water and the shower worked well. There was a television, mini-bar and safe but, as is usual in European hotels outside the UK, no tea-making facilities. No problem - the hotel is brilliantly situated just off St. Mark's Square and very close to the Fenice opera house with several good coffee bars used by locals and tourist nearby. As for being in a '"dodgy area" and down a dark alley, the annexe entrance is no more than 20 paces into the lane which opens into a brightly lit and busy street full of very exclusive - and very expensive - shops. This is the equivalent of Venice's Bond Street. We wonder if the other reviewers actually ventured beyond St. Marks and the Riva de Schiavone as the whole city is made up of intriguing dark alleys - the greatest pleasure of visiting the city is to explore these. We have never felt in any way threatened or in danger in these narrow streets - Venice seems to be one of the safest, and most pleasurable, cities to explore at night. This is a great budget option - we booked with Expedia and got four nights in a fantastic location for less than Â£50 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Never Never stay here”
Reviews.Author: mumski62
Reviews.Content: My son and fiancee stayed for a romantic getaway, they booked on Hotels.com and where not informed of ...the grotty annex.... nor the lack of a lift, and the dodgey area. This place is awful. shower was cold first day then stopped completly on the 2nd day. hotel manager not willing to do anything for them. At no time was they told, they where not in the Hotel that was advertised, and had booked a double room, and got a 2 twin beds made up like a double. Please dont stay here, as this manager is getting away with ripping people off, and if everyone doesnt go there, he will have to change.....hopefully Also says complimentry breakfast...but they where then told ...as they where in the annex, it doesnt count and cant have it !!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrible, Unbelievably Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: JenFuh8D
Reviews.Content: If you read other reviews on this hotel, all of the people that had the convenience of staying in the main building thought it was wonderful. All the others that stayed in the "Annex" building (which we were NOT informed about when we booked) thought it was horrid and would never recommend this hotel to anyone else. Yes, the hotel was in a good location, not far from St. Mark's Square. The staff were friendly enough, nothing to be remembered. The "Annex" building is in a very small alley way, could be very dangerous if travelling alone. There is no lift/elevator, (as seen in photos from the website). We were on the fourth or fifth floor and it was no easy trek. Upon arriving inside the room, the smell was very unpleasant. The towels in the bathroom smelled of vinegar along with the rest of the linens in the room. The mini-bar was hardly cold. The television was dated, the decor was old and down right ugly. Not to mention the room was hardly big enough for me, my fiance, and our luggage to sit comfortably. The shower was very small, had no hot water the first day, and completely stopped working the next day. When we got into bed the first night, we quickly found out that we did not have a double bed. We had two twin beds, pushed together and made up to look like one big bed!! There was no way to make yourself tea, coffee, no way to iron your clothes, I have never had such a bad experience at a hotel before. I would not recommend this hotel to even my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Run away from this so-called hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vanjacobson Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Although well-located (near Piazza San Marco), we were profoundly disappointed with this hotel (service, cleanness, cordiality). To get a glimpse of what happened, see my points: - Terrible facilities: Hotel has 2 buildings - the main building (where pictures have been taken to the website) and another annex quite far from the former and which will make you go upstairs (we have climbed three floors with our heavy luggage). Facilities smell like a godforsaken place. - Incorrect Information in their website: There is NO Internet in the hotel (except in the first floor of the main building), which means if you are located in the other annex, you should get you laptop and walk along the streets of Venice to get to the other building and use the Internet. - Terrible personnel: One of the hotel managers have suggested to me: "If you want Internet and good facilities, why didn't you book a 4/5 stars hotel?". I was insulted by his irony and lack of interest on assisting a customer. - Smelly rooms and bad infrastructure: smelly rags being used as towels, old television set, uncomfortable bathroom with a bad shower -- my overall rate of the room 1 out of 5. - Result: We slept one night but checked out in the morning and moved ourselves to another hotel just across the calle (Hotel Ala - Best Western). It doesn't worth the money and your worried mind, SKIP this hotel and get a better one (I suggest Hotel Ala - Best Western, close to this hotel, good rooms and excellent staff).

Reviews.Title: “not great, but good location”
Reviews.Author: kizza82
Reviews.Content: just returned from hotel torino, arrived and staff were fairly nice, the man who looked like borat was helpful. we had to leave our passports at reception for a few hours, but the hotel entrance is on a main busy road and was concerned because reception is unattened at times and passports are visable from the street. we then had to walk round to a different building a few hundred metres away. our room was on the 4 floor up several flights which are very steep and this is very tiresome each time you have to trek up them. we booked room only basis, and room only it was. the room was very small and you could not swing a cat in it, seen bigger shoe boxes. we were annoyed to find no tea making facilities and were told if we wanted tea and coffee we would need to pay 10euros per person per day for breakfast. the room could do with a deep clean and update. the bathroom was tiny and you could not even move in the shower. the tv did not work and the mini bar fridge was barely cold. also the air con was pathetic. i would not call it air con just a mere slight gust of cold air now and then. on a good note the location is great for st marks and the main tourist area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: batland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Torino for 4 nights durning our 3 week stay in Italy. We loved the location. Very close to San Marco and in a very nice area. We have two children so the room we had, had one queensize bed and two pull out beds. This did make the room very cramped, but for the price we didn't care. Our room also included breakfest every morning, which help cut cost for our family. The staff was very nice especially Raymond (sorry can't remember how to spell it the Italy way). He would give us suggestions on where to go and directions. Very friendly to the kids. The only downfall was we couldn't open the windows due to the fact that a cafe was below and the cigarette smoke would come right into our room. But the air conditioner worked just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely B&B close to Piazza San Marco”
Reviews.Author: Udayadittya
Reviews.Content: A delightful B&B tucked in a small alley, a short walk away from from Piazza San Marco, and the nearest water-bus stop (Santa Maria del Giglio), Hotel Torino offers rooms both in the main building as well as in an annexe building (Ca' Minotto) a minute away from the main hotel. We were a little apprehensive initially when we realized that we wouldn't be staying in the main hotel, but the room was an absolute delight, very spacious with a four-poster bed, canopies, beautiful paintings on the ceiling, done up in a lovely shade of pink. Not usual for a hotel, isn't it? The breakfast was basic but wholesome. We had an early check-out, and the hotel staff packed our breakfast for the day in a nice and thoughtful gesture - small things that touch your heart!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a very good location!”
Reviews.Author: monheganwoman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient to St. Mark's Square and therefore easy to reach once you get off the vaporetto with all the luggage! Room was nicely decorated. The elevator could use some updating, but it got to a point that since we were on the 2nd floor we walked up. We did not try the A/C as we kept the windows open - however this allowed for mosquitos to make themselves at home. Breakfast was adequate and the cappucino is delightful. I'd stay here again if I was interested in the toursty side of Venice. Otherwise the other side of the canal is much quieter and will choose that for the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “not what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: sassariengland
Reviews.Content: definately not a hotel with three stars plus. Booked room with breakfast- I am still waiting- receptionist decided that I hadnt and would not concede that what I had written on my booking form was correct. Got put in an attic room four floors up- smelt damp and dusty. Still wating for the tea facilites that says are avaiable in the room- felt like "flowers in the attic". No lift seperate buidling- not good . Will not go back and staff on when we booked in was very rude in both Italian and English!

Reviews.Title: “My choice in Venice every time - good price and fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: LBelard
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Hotel Torino 7 times since 2002, and it remains my choice whenever my wife and I go to Venice, which is roughly once a year. I first chose Hotel Torino because of its fabulous location, just a few minutes walk from Piazza San Marco (I am handicapped, so I always choose to be very close to where I want to go). And, considering the usual prices for hotels in Venice, Torino ends up being really affordable. Of course it is not a 5-star hotel, nor does it pretend to have the commodities some tourists, especially americans, tend to look for in hotels abroad; but Torino does have something that is much more valuable for me - and that is character. The main building is actually a 15th-century Palazzo, and still has half a coat-of-arms in stone on the stairway hall; the rooms are furnished in true venetian style - some rooms even have the walls lined with fabric, silk or similar. I have known Torino for a few years now, and I know what some customers are talking about when they refer to "bad rooms", but I must say that the main building was completely refurbished recently and now has really great rooms. On the first floor, one of the rooms is especially prepared for handicapped persons and it is really fabulous. I added one of my pictures of that room. And Hotel Torino now has a lift on the main building, which is great for me and all handicapped or elderly customers, or even couples with small children, and it is not often that you can find a lift on the smaller Venice hotels, especially those situated in ancient or historical buildings. So, I heartily recommend Hotel Torino. I am going to Venice again next July (2010) and I have no doubt I will book Torino again. Besides, all the staff has always been exceptionally friendly, and after all these years they have become almost like family to us...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the price in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Glenmoron
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week . Our room was 23 on 2nd floor in the annex (luggage carried up the stair for us). The entrance to the annex was fine...most route off the main streets are narrow in Venice and this was not intimidating. Room was old fashioned but this actually gave it charm! Bed was very comfortable and ensuite (excellent shower, toilet, bidet) was standard for a small hotel. It was cold when we arrived and the heating was on full blast so we adjusted it down to a more comfortable level. There was no airconditioning apparently which did not bother us for most of the week although the weather became warmer during our last few days and there was a decision to be made regarding whether to close the window to avoid mosquitos that were beginning to show their presence or open it to give more comfort during the night. Breakfast was a good buffet in the main hotel, Staff were all very friendly and the reception very well informed and present during the 24 hours. We had to leave very early for the airport (Alilaguna from San Marco at 03.40) and we were offered a "doggy bag" breakfast to take with us - most surprising and very welcome!). We did not pay much for the hotel (package via Dreamticket from Edinburgh) and really this hotel gave excellent value for our price. We bought valparetto, museum and Alilaguna tickets online viia Venice Connected before we left home and this gave great discounts. We ate in the student quarter of San Paolo, on Lido and at Fondamenta Nuova where the restaurants were better value than San Marco and found some great fresh pizza places. It was an excellent holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad rooms”
Reviews.Author: Knut1971
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the rooms in the annex. Very small and oldfashioned rooms. The aircondition didn`t work. Steep stairs. They carried our luggage when arrival, so that was good. The service at the reception wasn`t that good. Very good location, though..

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely superb!”
Reviews.Author: paws2paws
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 122 at the Hotel Torino for four nights from 29th Dec - 2nd Jan 2010. To begin with the location of this hotel is brilliant, so close to the main areas, all within a few minutes walking distance. Our room is the room featured on the Hotel's Web Site (the blue room) and it was really beautiful. Very comfortable and we had no problems with the windows being opened during the day. Breakfast was basic but it was fine and what with all the fabulous cafes/restaurants nearby we were never short of good food! Very friendly reception all the time and very helpful when enquiries were made. There is no bar in the hotel but again, location takes care of this! Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, with wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: goffboy
Reviews.Content: On recommendation of friend, we booked Hotel Torino for a 3 night stay. Hotel is in perfect location (less than 10 minutes from Piazza San Marco and Academia). Staff were incredibly charming and helpful. Like most hotels in Venice, it was very quiet between 11pm & 5am but actually wasn't that noisy at any time. Only suggestion I would have is don't open the windows! We got attacked by mosquitos, despite it being late November. Also our room was a little shabby (crack in ceiling, bits of string hanging of 4-poster bed curtains), but it that respect it was very Venice. I'd highly recommend this to anyone looking for a great spot in centre of Venice that is not too expensive. And do book via their website - they have a lot of great deals.

Reviews.Title: “Economical in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: mcgrawgrl4
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Annex at Hotel Torino - on the top floor, so it was a bit of a hike after walking all day, but this hotel could not have a better location. Very near to great shopping, food, and St. Mark's square. The staff was great. The air conditioning wasn't amazingly cold for the middle of summer, but we really only spent time in our room at night. This hotel was perfect for what we needed!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay”
Reviews.Author: traveller92879
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is great, but the room is horrible. The supposedly better "superior rooms" are located in an old building behind the main hotel, accessed via a dark back alley. The hotel room and the corridors are dark and the furnishings are very dated. The air conditioning runs half speed. Even the fan that the hotel brought in to alleviate the heat problem also runs half speed. Both the mini refridgerator and the TV run part time, because they switch off when you turn off the main light in the room. The drinks are thus always warm. When I made the booking, the hotel insisted that the superior rooms are bigger and better even though the rooms in the main building are renovated. For an enjoyable stay in Venice, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “great location,friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kayc68
Reviews.Content: Torino is only 5 mins from St Marks Square.We stayed in the main hotel so I cant comment on the annex but our room was very good on the 1st floor of the main hotel.All the staff were very helpful, and there was plenty of choice at breakfast. we found Venice was great but expensive

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: 60Tanya
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in perfect location close to all the attractions. We had room #130 and i would recommend it as it has it's own private balcony. If you don't mind the noise until 4 am I would suggest this room. Overall great stay, would come back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Keiko54
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Hotel Torino. We stayed in the Annex Building, which was nice because we got the entire floor to ourselves. The staff were friendly and helpful and the location was awesome! It was near St. Mark's Square and very easy to navigate to and from. The only complaint is our air conditioner was broken and we opened the windows and mosquitoes got in our room. So we got bit but other than that it was fabulous!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: vayio
Reviews.Content: Hotel Torino is just perfect, the best hotel I ever stayed in Venice. I stayed there during my 4th wedding anniversary and I must say It was my best anniversary ever. After my request I was given classic double no 122 (the blue one at the hotel's webpage pics). Room was perfect, even better than the pics show. Very comfotable, very clean, with flat TV, airconticion, sofa, little round table and chairs all in Venice style and new. Bathroom was also new, clean and very modern (especially the bathtub). Hotel manager offered us a bottle of prosecco which was a nice surprice. Every morning breakfast was served in our room free of charge! Except for the romantic of the whole thing, this was good because breakfast room is very small and I suppose it's difficult for anyone to find a seat and eat confortable there (the only negative about the hotel). But we avoided the whole procedure. Continental breakfast was simple, but top quality (especially the cappucino and the croissants). Also compared to other similar hotels I've stayed, rooms are good soundproofed. Staff was friendly and polite. Next time I' ll visit Venice I ll stat at hotel Torino for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JapanYui
Reviews.Content: All I can say is FANTASTIC. We had a nice and clean room at the back of the main building with a little terrace. Good breakfast and nice staff. I love the young lady who works in the breakfast room with a long hair beacause she's always smiling and so symphatic. And she's so very friendly and helpful, very professional. I would suggest this hotel to all of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Super Torino.”
Reviews.Author: emarin78
Reviews.Content: After staying in a cheap hotel in Venice, my gf and wanted somewhere nice to stay for a the rest of our week.Called the hotel, they were very helpful and got us great deal.The hotel is renovated and it is very nice. They have a good breakfast and serve expressos and you can have it in your room. Very clean and nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ValentinaMalta
Reviews.Content: What a holiday. Venice is super beautifull and going back to the hotel after a full day of walking around was a pleasure. Staff were very polite. Rooms are on the small size but very clean. The breakfast area is also very small. Breakfast is continental and it keeps you going for hours. They also serve the most delicious cappuccino on earth. Location is super, just one block behind piazza San Marco and it is situated in a very nice part of Venice. Gondola and Vaporretto services are a stone throw away. I will definitley recommed this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: manfredvan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a 2 night package in Venice for Â£120.00 / p.p B&B through Thomas Cook, not expecting much from the hotel because of the price. How wrong could we be! The hotel was easy to find and is perfectly located a short walk from St Marks Square on a select shopping street. The hotel was beautifully appointed, the room allocated was the red room illustrated and was quiet and very comfortable. The continental breakfast offered a good selection and all the staff were polite and helpful. We will definately be staying again and would recommend it for anyone wanting a short break in the beautiful city of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Uli_likes2travel
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at the Hotel Torino and I can recommend this hotel. The location is absolutely great. It's very close to San Marco and the Vaporetti. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Our room was in the main building (standard room), very small, but clean, charming and cosy. The bed was a bit hard, but better than too soft (imo). The breakfastroom is rather small, but since we were there in February (before Carneval) I guess the hotel was not full and we never had problems with getting a table. They're offering a small buffet breakfast. The coffee is undrinkable (like in most hotels around the world), but there's a watercooker and you can make your own tea. And a few steps outside the hotel you can drink an espresso. There was also an elevator in the main building - guess this is new too - at least it wasn't there 4 years ago when we first stayed at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: polaris66
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely week-end in the Hotel Tornio and would recommend it to anyone. The rooms where very clean and well presented and the staff friendly and very helpful. I must add that we stayed in the hotel and not the annexe. The Hotel is in a central location and is easy to find. The only negative that I have about the hotel is the size of the breakfast room. This is very small and if more than 8 people arrive for breakfast it is very cramped. The breakfast is OK and will keep you going for a couple of hours. I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “quiet clean perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: fvandewouwer
Reviews.Content: I can recommend this hotel to everybody who needs a clean, quiet place to stay. Location is the best, near to San Marco and transportation. Although we found the bed a bit too hard, we did sleep well because of the quietness. The room is not that big but it is spotless clean and very charming. Also staff is very friendly and helpfull. Breakfast was good. If we would stay again, we would stay at the Hotel Torino, no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Old can be beautiful, or it can be run down!”
Reviews.Author: big_hungry_baboon
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this property as part of the Italian leg of our honeymoon. Off course Venice should be a romantic stop-over and we wanted a hotel to match. So after reading several revues of Torino we decided it offered us old stlye luxury rooms. We didn't want a modern place, we thought Torino had character. Not at all. Our room was in the annex of the hotel and had no charm at all. It was an old style room that could have been fantastic but actually just looked run down. It was lacking in stlye and service(we couldn't even find a list of numbers so we could call reception from the room, so no champagne from room service!) This is another place that could be fantastic, but ends up being just okay. Not what we were hoping for. The location is fantastic for the tourist sights which are incredible, but we found we enjoyed Venice so much mor once we got away from the tourist areas close to the hotel. It was also very clean and the aircon was a must for the extreme heat and humidity. But for the price we could have stayed in a 4*!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: HarvyB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Venice in October and stayed at Hotel Torino for 4 nights. Our experience in Venice and the hotel was Fabulous. I cannot fault a thing with the hotel. It was simply amazing. The hotel was clean, fantastic location and the staff were so helpful and friendly. I will definetly go back, sooner rather than later. Thank you to eveyone at the hotel for making our trip so enjoyable and wonderful. Harvinder, London

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: Elizabethscotland11
Reviews.Content: We spent five days at the Hotel Torino,venice in middle october weather was perfect. We stayed in the annex, 2 minutes from hotel,full of character, maid service excellent,great breakfasts, very helpful staff. position of hotel very good when coming off vaporetta with luggage with cases. Venice was magical as was the islands,this was our 40th wedding anniversary trip. It was great to Venice to yourselves when the tour buses leave, would recommend this hotel to anyone, hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Just so perfect”
Reviews.Author: Xena444
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel and entered the very small reception desk area. There was a German couple in front of us complaining because there was no lift and the woman had a walking stick (probably should have checked that before they booked)- so we weren't expecting much, however, a staff member checked us in and another one escorted us OUTof the building and round the back via a few little windy streets. We were wondering what was going on. We carried our bags up several flight of stairs which looked like the undecorated workmen's access route and were shown our room. Well... what can I say- we had been given a room with a massive four poster bed decorated beautifully in burgundy and that gorgeous shade of Venetian pale green. Ther was a frieze above the bed with cherubs and flowers, and we just fell in love. The room was not huge by any means and neither was the bathroom, but it was perfect for us. You could lean out the windows and look up the narrow streets with the canal just in view below and to the right. The windows had huge shutters on them which meant we weren't wakened by the morning light. We had booked room only so I can't say what breakfast was like but on the morning of (very early am) departure- the staff had prepared us a bag full of a continental breakfast to take away with us which really made a difference. We fell in love with this room and we fell in love with Venice.

Reviews.Title: “bad dream”
Reviews.Author: danmirela
Reviews.Content: Bad dream! maybe the new part is refurbished,but the "luxury part"-terrible!200 euros is not big money for Venice hotels,but I've stayed in better hotels for one half price!Be carefull:your honey moon became a bad dream!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay here”
Reviews.Author: Zara8
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay here with two of our children. We found the rooms a nice size and the decorative order and furnishings were excellent. The shower/toilet area was very clean. Having read some of the previous reviews, I was very worried what we were letting ourselves in for! It looks like it may have been recently re-furbished, so we were pleasantly surprised. The breakfast was very good and the hotel staff very helpful. Would definately stay here again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Scruffy, tatty and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: joceLondon
Reviews.Content: Oh dear! I agree with other comments. The room looked nothing like the pictures on the website. We too had booked a superior room for a `significant' birthday celebration. The ceiling was cracked and looked as if it was about to fall down, the `canopy' on the four-poster bed, was hanging off, and the bedspread was stained! To top it all you had to walk through the streets to get to the breakfast room, which was in a corridor. There weren't enough tables to seat everyone, so if you arrived late, you had to wait for a table. Breakfast was awful, the worst crime being that the coffee (in Italy!) was foul! The only bright spot was that the owner was really friendly, and we didn't have the heart to complain. But we probably will by email.

Reviews.Title: “It looks nothing like its website suggests”
Reviews.Author: timothyplank
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely nothing like the photos on its website. We were given a room that was so small that once our small bags were on the floor, there was no space to move, other than to climb over them to reach the bed. The bathroom was tiny with a dodgy shower and the room stank of stale cigarettes so bad we couldn't get rid of it. They had offered a safe place for our bicycles but left them downstairs with their front door open and nobody around. Had we not noticed this due to an early morning I'm sure they would have been toast. The only good thing about the place is location. Don't expect much else.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful location for honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: adinutza
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Torino, in our honeymoon , last year in october .It was excellent, the staff was ok, we had breakfast in our room. The location is great, near St Marco Square , the gondola is near hotel. The room was not so large, but the bathroom and the balcony were.In concluzion, we enjoyed staying there.

Reviews.Title: “great location, terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: dangerFlorida
Reviews.Content: A dirty, run-down hotel in a great location. I spend over 80 nights a year in hotels and this may have been my worst room in decades.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: notrobin
Reviews.Content: Good location for St Marks Square but beware pickpockets between the hotel and the square. My son and his girlfriend stayed in Room 228 which was OK though the window was high and miniscule. We stayed in 138 which had a very mouldy shower. Avoid this room. The breakfast was OK. The reception staff were mostly OK. Overall not what I expect for 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “never stay here”
Reviews.Author: motiv8matt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very run down. Everything is falling apart. The rooms are big enought to walk around the bed and that is it. I was afraid to sleep at night after we saw a rat in the hotel. It smelled very bad. The shower drain did not work and the floors were stained. We stayed in several hotels before this one, but this one did not even come close. When we complained at the front desk, the clerk said "what do you expect we are a 3 star not 5 star hotel". I would not even call this a 1 star hotel. They are in a good location, but need to demolish the place and rebuild.

Reviews.Title: “** Ideal for a short City Break **”
Reviews.Author: E_voc
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner where looking for a nice hotel which didnt cost too much with adequate facilities for 3 nights. The staff where very friendly and helpful. We where told our room number and found it with no problem. Our room had a double bed in the middle on the right with side tables, a set of drawers next to the window and a big wardrobe next to the door. Had a en-suite (not all rooms have en-suites) which was small but ideal with accessories to shower. The bed was comfortable and was made every day we where there. The furniture was old fashioned but what do you expect for such a beautiful city. The breakfast was continental and if it was busy you struggled to get into the small room which consisted of six 2 chaired tables. Cereals, croissants with coffee, tea and orange juice facilites where availble. This kept us going through the morning.All in all the hotel is ideal for a short stay which you don't spend alot of time in due to site seeing in Venice etc. Only a short walk from st marks square and the grand canel. We had no problems at all and if came to venice again for a short break i would stay hear. A friendly hotel set in a ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, Enjoyed the Annex - free concert every night outside”
Reviews.Author: barnesyboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights in the Annex on the 3rd floor. Large bed and clean room. Bathroom a little small but adequate. Continental breakfast was ok. Staff were very friendly. Location was superb, a few minutes walk from St Marks Sq and the gondolas! Very nice restaurants nearby. A very good base for exploring and shopping. Every night there was either a violinist of guitarist outside until about 11pm but the music was great. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Hotel Annex”
Reviews.Author: mechevarria
Reviews.Content: Apparently Hotel Torino is divided into two sections. The rooms located within the hotel and another set of rooms located in an alley about 100 meters from the hotel. Unfortunately for me and my husband we stayed in the alley location. The room was very dark and tiny. Based on this experience I do not recommend this hotel to anyone. The hotel service was good but the comfort and location of our room was an undesirable one. Beware when booking your room and make sure you let them know that you would like a room within the hotel. We were unaware of this arrangement and wished that this information would have been provided prior to our booking.

Reviews.Title: “This place couldn't be worse.”
Reviews.Author: AlessandroF
Reviews.Content: We booked a room in this hotel as it was perfectly located, minutes from St Marks and the shopping area. Unfortunately, we found it to be small, with no lounge or communal seating area, the smallest breakfast room Ive ever seen, and rooms which need an urgent makeover. Don't stay at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed at first, improved later”
Reviews.Author: PatCrit
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel is very good, at the end of the Calle Larga XXII Marzo. We arrived in the worst possible circumstances, at 5 on a wet windy morning, after a long trip, and were greeted by a surly sleepy-looking long-haired night receptionist, who made it very clear he was annoyed by our arrival. Instead of a room in the main hotel building we were made to walk to one of the annexes (in pouring rain) and told that our room was on the top floor (no lift), and this room was extremely small and uncomfortable. Quite disappointing. Later on however I spoke to the day staff, extremely nice and helpful people, who moved us to a lovely room in the main building, a great relief. Breakfast was adequate, the usual continental, and the rest of our stay was relatively enjoyable. Many thanks to the day staff, but the night receptionist needs an intense course in manners and how to deal properly with guests.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Torino
HotelInfo.Address: Calle delle Ostreghe, 2356 | San Marco, 30124 Venice, Italy
